fieldNames.title: Choose what you want to calculate:

fieldInfosSaving.startCapital:
Enter the amount you would like to invest at the beginning.
The default value for the date of the first investment is the 1st day of the next month.
You can use the drop-down icon to set additional options for one-time payments.
fieldInfosSaving.startDate:
Enter the date on which you would like to invest the starting capital in your savings plan. By default this is the 1st of the next month. 
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosSaving.oneTimeInvestment: Enter the amount of the additional one-time investment here.
fieldInfosSaving.oneTimeInvestmentDate:
Enter the date of the additional one-time investment here.
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosSaving.savingRate:
Enter the monthly amount that you would like to regularly invest in your savings plan.
You can use the drop-down symbol to set additional options for the savings rate.
fieldInfosSaving.savingPlanStart: Select the date on which you would like to start your monthly savings payments. If no date is specified, the savings rate is applied for the total investment period. Format : DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosSaving.savingPlanEnd: Select the date on which you would like to end your monthly savings payments. If no date is specified, the savings rate is applied for the total investment period. Format : DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosSaving.dynamicFactor: Enter a parameter that defines the percentage by which the monthly savings rate annually increases. Example: With a monthly savings rate of €50 and a factor of 150%, you will have to save €75 per month for the next year.
fieldInfosSaving.interestRate: Enter the interest rate in percent that you expect on your savings. Interest is extra money you get when you save money.
fieldInfosSaving.endDate:
Enter the date on which your savings plan should end here. By default this is set to 10 years from the start date.
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosSaving.endValue: Enter the amount you would like to reach by the end of your savings plan. The final capital is your financial goal.

fieldInfosWithdraw.startDate:
Enter the date on which you would like to invest the starting capital in your Withdrawal plan. By default this is the 1st of the next month.
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosWithdraw.savingRate:
Enter the monthly amount that you would like to regularly invest in your Withdrawal plan.
You can use the drop-down symbol to set additional options for the Withdraw rate.
fieldInfosWithdraw.savingPlanStart:
Select the date on which you would like to start your monthly Withdrawal. If no date is specified, the Withdraw rate is applied for the total investment period.
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosWithdraw.savingPlanEnd:
Select the date on which you would like to end your monthly Withdrawal. If no date is specified, the Withdraw rate is applied for the total investment period.
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosWithdraw.dynamicFactor: Enter a parameter that defines the percentage by which the monthly Withdraw rate annually increases. Example: With a monthly Withdraw rate of €50 and a factor of 150%, you will have to save €75 per month for the next year.
fieldInfosWithdraw.interestRate: Enter the interest rate in percent that you expect on your savings. Interest is extra money you get when you save money.
fieldInfosWithdraw.endDate:
Enter the date on which your Withdrawal plan should end here. By default this is set to 10 years from the start date.
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
fieldInfosWithdraw.endValue: Enter the amount you would like to reach by the end of your Withdrawal plan. The final capital is your financial goal.

fieldInfosCombo.withdrawBegin:
Enter the date on which your savings plan should end and your withdrawal plan should start.
Format: DD/MM/YYYY.
